poem:
### Undisturbed Song

On Dorset's quiet plains  
where oil's black promise sleeps,  
the Dartford warbler sings—  
a fragile thread of life.  
Beneath the hum of machines,  
a melody unwinds,  
each note a testament  
to careful guardianship.  
In the dance of industry and nature,  
a delicate song persists.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dartford warblers on the Dorset oilfields | Brief letters When working as a librarian in a scientific research station for the gas industry, I was used to obscure demands for information. Among these were regular requests from the biologists about wildlife, flora and fauna on the Dorset oilfields. The Dartford warbler (Country diary, 30 June) was largely conserved due to the diligence of our scientists, anxious to ensure the drilling did not have an adverse". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
